result.execSummary:
The defendant John I Lyons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John I Lyons is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John I Lyons was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • John I Lyons was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Original amount amended from $696.00 to $496.00.  DNA surcharges were remitted.  sm

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. W/H adjudication on ct 1. If def successfully completes probation w/ no new arrests rising to the level of probable cause & no ATR's, the State would not object to a motion filed by the def to dismiss ct 1.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.
$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $253  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Comply w/ Chapter 51 treatment order & any other treatment needs identified by the Dept.
$243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.
